definition: 100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: The members of a collegial panel shall be odd in number.
sentences.chinese: 合議庭的成員人數應當是單數。

sentences.english: The deliberations shall be recorded in writing, and the transcript shall be signed by the members of the collegial panel.
sentences.chinese: 評議應當製作筆錄，由合議庭成員簽名。

sentences.english: The people's court shall form a new collegial panel for the purpose of the retrial.
sentences.chinese: 人民法院審理再審案件，應當另行組成合議庭。

sentences.english: The penalization of cases should respect the opinions of the entire court.
sentences.chinese: 案件的判罰要尊重合議庭的意見。

sentences.english: The parties concerned in the case shall be notified the change of collegiate members.
sentences.chinese: 合議庭成員的更換情況應當及時通知訴訟當事人。

sentences.english: In civil cases of second instance in the people's court, justice is administered by a collegiate bench made up of judges.
sentences.chinese: 人民法院審理第二審民事案件，由審判員組成合議庭。

sentences.english: The number of members of a collegial panel shall be an odd number of three or more.
sentences.chinese: 合議庭的成員，應當是三人以上的單數。

sentences.english: The judge states collegiate bench closes this case adjudicates choose an auspicious day after discussing.
sentences.chinese: 法官表示合議庭合議後將擇日宣判此案。

sentences.english: The collegiate bench investigates to Zhang the relative, knew that Zhang the father spirit is not normal.
sentences.chinese: 合議庭又向張某親屬調查，得知張某之父精神不正常。
